oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Letter from WWB to Jennie Safford
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Author relates that his US Army regiment arrived at Ft. Donelson one day after the (second) Battle of Ft. Donelson (also called the Battle of Dover)""I was on the Battle Ground and saw four dead men and dead Horse[s] without number--it was a dreadful sight." The men are camped outside Nashville and on their way to Murfreesboro. WWB reports he is getting "quite fleshy," weighs 185 lbs., and can march 5-6 miles a day with gun and cartridge box.
